The young Gazans killed at Al-Baqa café
description: On June 30, an Israeli airstrike killed dozens in a Gaza City café. Many young professionals, who embody Gazan resilience after 21 devastating months of war, died that day. Le Monde looks back on four of their lives.

Syria says pulling troops from Druze heartland after US request
description: Announcing the new ceasefire on Wednesday, Syria's interior ministry said there would be a 'total and immediate halt to all military operations,' as well as the formation of a committee comprising government representatives and Druze spiritual leaders to supervise its implementation.

headline: Trump cancels billions in funds for California high-speed rail
description: The country's first fully high-speed rail line, planned to run about 220 miles (355 kilometers) between Los Angeles and Las Vegas, is expected to be completed by 2028, in time for the Olympic Games. Launched in 2008, the project to connect the two main cities has seen numerous delays and overshot budgets.

headline: With 'Eddington,' Ari Aster has crafted a dark, cynical fable about an America on the verge of collapse
description: At 39, the American director is tapping into a vein of contemporary nihilism, where the grotesque and the outrageous overlap amid the terrifying spectacle of the Trump era.

headline: In Arles, Fragonard's Museum of Fashion and Costume gracefully unveils treasures
description: With a collection of 20,000 garments and accessories, the Musée Fragonard de la Mode et du Costume opened its doors on July 6. Housed in the former Bouchaud de Bussy mansion, which the architects of Studio KO have shaped into a Provençal jewel box, the museum showcases three centuries of traditional dress history.

'His return was a miracle, but he had changed': The first free summer of Lyon's Holocaust survivors
description: 'The Summer of 1945' (3/6). As Lyon celebrated the Liberation, survivors of the death camps tried to reconnect with daily life, despite hardship, silence, and widespread incomprehension.

headline: Xi: The father, the son and the party
description: Given that Xi Jinping's father was a reformer, should his son not have been one as well? In the first English-language biography of the Chinese president's father, the author sees within the current leader's conservatism the cultural mark of absolute devotion to the Chinese Communist Party.

headline: How North Korea infiltrates its IT experts into Western companies
description: Developers working under false identities aim to funnel their salaries back to the North Korean state or blackmail their employers. Major companies have been affected, primarily in the United States but, more recently, also in France.
